item.value: The banana tree is not actually a tree, it is a herb. It bears fruit once a year and then dies.
The heaviest apple weighed 1.849 kg (4 lb 1 oz) and was grown and picked by Chisato Iwasaki at his apple farm in Hirosaki City, Japan October 24, 2005.
There are 195 countries in the world and there are more than 2,700 languages.
The Population of the Earth is about 6,800,000,000 (6.80 billion). China has the most people, its population is 1.3 billion.
The world's shortest alphabet, used in the Solomon Islands, has only 11.
The biggest earthquake ever recorded occurred in Chile, in 1960. Known as the Great Chilean Earthquake, the quake measured 9.5 on the Richter scale.
Orville and Wilbur Wright achieved the first flight of an airplane.on the morning of December 17, 1903.
Mount McKinley in Alaska is the highest mountain in America. It is 20,320 ft high. Alaska is also the largest state in America, it is 656,425 square miles in size.
The tallest person in the world was Robert Wadlow. He was 2.72 meters ( 8ft 11in ) tall.
Michael Jackson's 1982 Thriller album is the biggest seller of all time. Over 110 millions albums were sold.
The most widely spoken language is Mandarin, nearly 1 billion people speak it, mainly in China.

The Spine-tailed Swift is the fastest bird. It can fly at 170 kilometres per hour (105mph). The Peregrine Falcon is the fastest bird that dives headfirst down through the sky. They can travel at up to 200mph.
If you could travel from Earth to the Sun in a plane it would take you 17 years
The elephant is distinguished by its high level of intelligence, interesting behavior, methods of communication and complex social structure.
The shortest woman was Pauline Muster. She was 58 cm ( 23 in ) tall.
The Cheetah is the fastest land animal. It can run at 112 kilometres per hour (70 mph). The average person can run from 12 - 17 miles an hour in sprints, so keep away from cheetahs.
English is the second most spoken language in the world.
The Pacific Ocean is the largest ocean in the world. It covers about 1/3 of its surface. It is 155.557 million sq km.
The blue whale can produce the loudest sound of any living animal. The sound can be detected as far away as 530 miles.

On 12 April 1961 Yuri Alekseyevich Gagarin, a Soviet cosmonaut , became the first human in outer space and the first to orbit the Earth. He became a hero of the Soviet Union for his pioneering tour in space.
